header: Order below exh.3 in Cri. MA No. 30/2019 CNR No. MHPU01­000115—2019

background.text: 1. Perused the application and documentary evidence placed on record. Heard the learned Counsel for the applicant. 2. By this application, under Section 438 of Cr.P.C., the applicant / accused – Shashikala Vijay Vetal seeks interim protection in Crime No. 787/2018, registered with Kondhwa Police Station, Pune, under Sections 420, 406 465, 467, 468, 471 r.w.s. 34 of Indian Penal Code.

arguments.text: 3. The learned Counsel for the applicant has submitted that the applicant has no role to play in alleged offences. The applicant is father of borrower of complaint­ bank.

The applicant is father of borrower of complaint­ bank.

arguments.text: 4. On going through copy of FIR, it is evident that son of the applicant had agreed to purchase a flat and paid some­sum, applied for home­loan. Thus, the transaction seems to be of civil nature.

Thus, the transaction seems to be of civil nature.

arguments.text: 5. In view of above, apprehension in the mind of applicant seems to be reasonable, warranting ad­interim protection, until hearing of exh.1. Hence, the order :

argumentSentences.text: In view of above, apprehension in the mind of applicant seems to be reasonable, warranting ad­interim protection, until hearing of exh.1.

order.text: ORDER 1) The application stands allowed as under :­ In the event of arrest, the applicant be released on furnishing P.R and S.B of Rs.15,000/­, on following conditions:­ a) She shall not tamper prosecution witnesses. b) She shall not leave India sans the permission of this Court. 2) Issue show cause notice to respondents as to why said order should not be confirmed.

processedText:
Order below exh.3 in Cri. MA No. 30/2019 CNR No. MHPU01­000115—2019 
---header-ends---
1. Perused the application and documentary evidence placed on record. Heard the learned Counsel for the applicant. 2. By this application, under Section 438 of Cr.P.C., the applicant / accused – Shashikala Vijay Vetal seeks interim protection in Crime No. 787/2018, registered with Kondhwa Police Station, Pune, under Sections 420, 406 465, 467, 468, 471 r.w.s. 34 of Indian Penal Code. 
---background-ends---
3. The learned Counsel for the applicant has submitted that the applicant has no role to play in alleged offences. The applicant is father of borrower of complaint­ bank. 
---argument-ends---
4. On going through copy of FIR, it is evident that son of the applicant had agreed to purchase a flat and paid some­sum, applied for home­loan. Thus, the transaction seems to be of civil nature. 
---argument-ends---
5. In view of above, apprehension in the mind of applicant seems to be reasonable, warranting ad­interim protection, until hearing of exh.1. Hence, the order : 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1) The application stands allowed as under :­ In the event of arrest, the applicant be released on furnishing P.R and S.B of Rs.15,000/­, on following conditions:­ a) She shall not tamper prosecution witnesses. b) She shall not leave India sans the permission of this Court. 2) Issue show cause notice to respondents as to why said order should not be confirmed. 
---order-ends---
Notice r/o: 18.01.2019. Pune. (Vikas S. Kulkarni) January 03, 2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. -3­ I affirm that the contents of this P.D.F.,file judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment. Name of Steno :­ Smt. Mohini P. Rahurkar, Stenographer Gr.I Court Name :­ Shri. Vikas S. Kulkarni, Additional Sessions Judge,Pune Date :­ January 03, 2019 Judgment signed by P.O.
